title: Singer/Songwriter James Taylor – Part 1
content:
Guest interviews are usually available online within 24 hours of broadcast.
In PART 1 of a two-night conversation, the iconic singer-songwriter talks about his first new album in thirteen years, Before This World. A big part of the folk revolution of the ‘60s and early ‘70s, James Taylor has earned 40 gold, platinum and multi-platinum awards, 5 Grammys and a nomination for Broadway's Tony Award. Raised in North Carolina, Taylor first studied cello before focusing on the guitar. He debuted on the Beatles' Apple Records and saw his songs influence songwriters and fans of all generations. Taylor is an inductee of both the Rock and Roll and Songwriters Halls of Fame, and recently released his first original album in thirteen years, titled Before This World.
